title: Theodore Roosevelt National Park: Juniper Campground
body: Juniper Campground       Juniper Campground - North Unit  The Juniper Campground is located four miles from the North Unit park entrance. Campsites are available year-round on a first-come, first-served basis; only the group campsite is reservable. Open Year-Round Information: 701-842-6828 General Information Sites: 50, pull-through and back-in sites Group Sites: 1 site, reservable (see below for information) Fees: $14 per site per night summer rates, $7 per night during winter rates. Summer rates are in effect. Discounts: Senior Pass or Access Pass holders receive a 50% discount. Maximum occupancy: 1 family or 6 people Facilities Restrooms: Flush toilets during main visitor season, pit toilet available year-round  Drinking Water: Spigots located throughout campground Showers: No Picnic Tables: One per site Grills: One per site RV Information Dump Station: Yes, during main visitor season Water Fill Station: Yes Electric hookups: No Sewer hookups: No Water hookups: No Juniper Group Site Information: Open May 1 - September 30. The Juniper Group Site is available by reservation only for groups of 7 to 60 people. Cost is $30 per night. Reservations can be made at recreation.gov or by calling 1-877-444-6777. (Theodore Roosevelt National Park cannot make reservations.)
